metadata.title: CVE-2020-0423 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In binder_release_work of binder.c, there is a possible use-after-free dueto improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege inthe kernel with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-161151868References: N/A

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0423` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16

linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.96~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1103.114~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.104~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1062.68~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
